Introduction to EpiViz

Source: vignettes/EpiViz.Rmd
EpiViz.Rmd

EpiViz: Circos plots for epidemiologists

Circos plots enable the visualization of large amounts of data in a compact, circular format. However, they can be complex to produce using low-level graphics engines. EpiViz streamlines this process for common epidemiological data structures, such as metabolite association studies or multi-exposure GWAS results.

Why use EpiViz?

  1. Efficiency: Reduce hundreds of lines of circlize code to a single function call.
  2. Standardization: Enforce consistent grouping and scaling across circular sectors.
  3. Professional Quality: Automatically generates legends using ComplexHeatmap for publication-ready figures.

Installation

You can install the development version of EpiViz from GitHub:

# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("mattlee821/EpiViz/R_package")

Core Elements of an EpiViz Plot

To understand how EpiViz constructs its visualizations, refer to the annotated guide below:

  • Sectors: Segments of the circle defined by a grouping variable (e.g., metabolite class).
  • Tracks: Rings within the circle where data is plotted (Points, Lines, Bars, or Histograms).
  • Labels: Variable names plotted on the outer edge.
  • Legend: Explanatory key for track colors and significance indicators.

For detailed usage, see the R Package Examples guide.
